content: We have 18 days left before 1.56 branches off. Before that we need to do the full crater run, stabilize --force-warn (cc @rylev), do an FCP on the edition as a whole, and merge the stabilization of the edition in both rustc and cargo.
FYI: I will be away from the 19th through the 30th so I won't be of much help then.
can you finish the force-warn stuff before that?
There's not much to do without lang team input as far as I'm aware. I'll look into it.

The ICEs we saw during the small crater run, #87987 and #87988 both have fixes available: #87996 and #88039. Both are waiting for review on @nikomatsakis. If we can't get those merged today, I propose we merge them into the crater run PR anyway to unblock that, and kick the crater run off today regardless.

rylev said:

There's not much to do without lang team input as far as I'm aware. I'll look into it.

Once the lang team discuss this (tomorrow), I should likely be able to do the work to change --force-warns to whatever the decision is on Wednesday (though I'll be on a train all day).
okay. the FCP for that should start this week, ideally tomorrow.

@nikomatsakis @rylev Should we meet quickly today or tomorrow to go over the planning and make some decisions on how to proceed? We can still make 1.56, but if we want to fix all the minor issues, then do a full crater run, fix any newly found issues, followed by a full FCP, it'll be tricky. We can probably parallize things a bit though.
@rylev Just to confirm, which issue or issues are you seeking input on, and are those issues nominated?
I want to make sure they're on today's agenda and make sure we get to them.
I'm around now
I would be up to meet at some point today/tomorrow, yes
i have time now and the next few hours
@Mara how up-to-date is the project board etc
was just updating it
should be complete now
I’m not free right now, but you can meet without me. I’ll be available in an hour

we need to decide how perfect everything needs to be before we're comfortable fcp'ing/shipping it. a few rare edge cases that don't migrate perfectly are probably okay. we should start assigning priorities to the issues
@Josh Triplett this is the issue (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/86516). It's labeled as nominated
well
I'm game to meet now I think to go over the issues
/me opening jitsi
Let me know what y'all decide
do you mind if I join? I'd like to be up to date on this for t-release hat as well, seems like a good opportunity to listen in at least?
https://meet.jit.si/Rust2021
(ping @nikomatsakis ^)
ok
@rylev I read the full history of that issue, and then I went ahead and started an FCP on it.

Oh, one thing I didn't mention, but my guess is we will want the edition group to help with drafting the section of the blog post for edition 2021 announcing -- whether it goes into 1.56 or 1.xx doesn't really matter much for that text. Based on my understanding of consensus, we'll want something of a typical length - maybe 2-3 paragraphs at most, 1 HTML "page" at most I'd guess.
yes!
that we can do after 1.56 branches off though, so less of a rush

2021-08-16 33 mo  top-10k crater run
2021-08-17    tu  analyze crater results
2021-08-18    we  get all FCPs started     <<<today>>>
2021-08-19    th
2021-08-20    fr
2021-08-21    sa
2021-08-22    su
2021-08-23 34 mo  start full crater run
2021-08-24    tu  (FCPs must have begun *before* this day)
2021-08-25    we
2021-08-26    th  analyze crater results
2021-08-27    fr
2021-08-28    sa
2021-08-29    su
2021-08-30 35 mo
2021-08-31    tu
2021-09-01    we
2021-09-02    th
2021-09-03    fr  1.56 branches off from master   <<<--- deadline for most things
2021-09-04    sa
2021-09-05    su
2021-09-06 36 mo
2021-09-07    tu
2021-09-08    we
2021-09-09    th  1.55 released as stable
~
six weeks
~
2021-10-21    th  1.56 + Rust 2021 released as stable
@nikomatsakis I don't have much time today. Do you have time to handle the FCP for the reserved prefixes?
Yep

The reserved prefixes FCP (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88140) and the closure captures FCP (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88126) have both not started yet. They need to start today to make it for Rust 1.56.

cc @nikomatsakis

We have four open bugs, all about the closure captures:

  • https://github.com/rust-lang/project-rfc-2229/issues/57 - Let statement with wildcard lead to warnings for unused variables
  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88118 - PlaceBuilder ICE, Part 2
  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88103 - rust-2021-incompatible-closure-captures trait evaluation overflow error
  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87814 - Closure captures immutable reference when mutable reference is necessary

only the last one has a PR (not yet reviewed). the first three have no solution yet.
I would not expect the trait overflow one to be fixable honestly
The compiler is just inherently doing more work now
yeah, it doesn't necessarily need to be fixed.
the others seem more important
I kicked off the full crater run. Most issues we saw last time should be fixed now.
@simulacrum what's the status of force-warn? (you took that on, right?)
I believe it's just waiting for the r+ on stabilization, I plan to check in / review that today
lang-team consensus seems to be to stabilize as-is, even if no one seems quite happy with that :) but seems ok.
looking now

simulacrum said:

lang-team consensus seems to be to stabilize as-is, even if no one seems quite happy with that :) but seems ok.

the main question, I guess, was whether to change the name? I'm indifferent
I'm going to deep dive into those issues a bit

Mara said:

simulacrum what's the status of force-warn? (you took that on, right?)

just checked in on this; it looks like it is indeed good to go and I expect to r+ stabilization in a few hours (once CI is done)
awesome, thanks!
Quick checkin on the RFC 2229 issues:

Mara said:

  • https://github.com/rust-lang/project-rfc-2229/issues/57 - Let statement with wildcard lead to warnings for unused variables

Fixed by https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/88271, which is r+ p=1

Mara said:

We have four open bugs, all about the closure captures:

  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88118 - PlaceBuilder ICE, Part 2
  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87814 - Closure captures immutable reference when mutable reference is necessary

Fixed by https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/88266 which is r+ p=1

Mara said:

  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/88103 - rust-2021-incompatible-closure-captures trait evaluation overflow error

sketched out how to fix but no PR yet
ah that's great! thanks for the updates!

Does anyone have an estimate for when https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/88100 (stabilize 2021) will be merged? I fear there is not much time left, and I would prefer to avoid needing to do beta backports.

There is still work needing to be done on the edition-guide, though I guess I can do that, maybe today.

I'm also guessing that we're not going to be able to get anyone to step up for working on reference docs?
I can do some work on reference docs
I guess we can make a final call re: #88100 on Monday?
but afaik there aren't really many blockers left?
I guess I should check the project board
I'm poking at something related to RFC 2229 now
and I wanted to write the "reserved prefix" reference docs
not sure what other changes are needed there, I guess I can try to look at open bugs and/or scour the edition guide
I'm not aware of any major blockers. I'm still slowly scanning the crater run. Most of the issues were expected, the rest are pretty minor, and can potentially be fixed later.
but I have looked at about 5% of the total failures.
I put the errors into groups to try to find the most interesting ones first.
I gotta run. Will be back in a couple hours.
yeah, let's make the decision on monday. i'll try to process some more crater results this weekend.
but so far i don't see any reason to not stabilize it in 1.56. :)
other important changes that still need to happen are simply changing wording in a bunch of places to talk about 2021 as the current edition, instead of as a future edition.
cargo using edition = "2021" by default, and showing that in the edition guide, etc.
Can someone set p=1 for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/88280? This is an edition blocker, it's failed to merge with 3 different rollups :sweat_smile:
done
Thanks!
